page.title: 02CAPEL_LE_FERNE _ ORIGIN.
page.content: There is no mention of Capel_le_ Ferne in the original Domesday Book. The village church of St Mary's was built before 1150 A.D.and gave its name to the village,"the Chapel amongst the Ferns."Through the ages the name has been spelt in various ways;in 1377 it was Capel-ete-Verne; in 1381 it was Capelle-ate-Verne;in 1535 Capellin-le-Ferne and by 1569 Capleferne.Since then it has always been referred to as Capel-le-Ferne. In 1841 Capel had 50 houses and a population of 247.In 1901 Capel was still entirely agricultural with a population of 231.The inhabitants lived in cottages within the vicinity of the church.These houses have now disappeared and with the building of the A20 trunk road a new village grew up along either side of the road. Today's population is almost 2000. .
